properties.name: Lotus Bud Sangha
properties.description: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition, our teacher is Vietnamese Zen Buddhist monk Thich Naht Hanh (Thay) who passed away in January 2022. Thich Naht Hanh is one of the most prominent spiritual teachers of the 20th century. He was a peace activist, poet, author and most importantly a sangha builder. His teachings about mindfulness are unsurpassed. Lotus Bud Sangha was established by our dear Vietnamese dharma teachers in the 1980s who wanted to share this practice with the Vietnamese community and the wider Australian community. From those small but powerful beginnings we have a number of lay sanghas in Sydney and now our own meditation centre Mountain Spring Monastery at Bilpin.We would love to have you practice with us. What is practicing you may ask? In our sangha (community of meditators) we practice sitting and walking meditation, learn about the dharma (Buddhist teachings) and share about our experiences on the path of practice. We welcome beginners and experienced meditators as we learn from each other wherever we are in our practice. The group of regular facilitators at Lotus Buds are experienced meditators in the Plum Village tradition. We have been taught and guided by dharma teacher John Barclay who received the lamp transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh. John has been leading the sangha for many years, by teaching the dharma and mentoring many of us. He is also a Buddhist scripture teacher to primary and secondary students in Sydney. Meditation can be challenging at times however being in a sangha supports our practice and makes it easier. Being in a sangha with friends with shared values and a shared practice brings us joy and gives us energy. With weekly practice and spiritual friendships the path becomes easier and more beautiful.Each Wednesday we practice sitting and walking mediation, recite trainings, or explore a teaching and share our reflections. Most importantly we learn about how meditation and the Plum Village practices can help us in our daily lives. Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings help us to transform our suffering so we can become more peaceful and happy. Wherever you may be in your meditation practice you are welcome to join us.

properties.description: We want to provide spiritual support, offer a safe and reliable place for Neurodivergents, so they can express and find peace in their conditions or diagnosis, without fear of judgments or discrimination.We recognise, embrace and accept our differences with the practice of Plum Village. Mindfulness helps us to regulate our mental and emotional behaviour, helps to control the brain into calm, improve our mood and reduce the feeling of pain. The Neurodivergence is not a disorder, it's just to be a little different. We are beautiful and colourful. You don't have to pretend to be anything else. There is nothing wrong with you. We say: “I can be myself, I accept it, I am loved. I am enough. We are enough”.

properties.name: Sangha Kahl
properties.address: Brühler Straße, Kahl am Main, Bavaria 63796 Germany
properties.description: Wir sind eine Gruppe von Frauen, die gemeinsam Achtsamkeit praktiziert und sich austauscht. Dabei sind wir zum Einen von der Plum Village-Tradition des buddhistischen Lehrers Thich Nhat Hanh inspiriert. Hier legen wir großen Wert auf Geh-Meditation. Zum Anderen praktizieren wir auch Wege von naturverbundener weiblicher Spiritualität, zum Beispiel inspiriert von Chameli Gad Ardagh (“Awakening Women”). Die Praxis wechselt sich ab:2 x Monat: Praxis nach Thich Nhat Hanh2 x Monat: Praxis in weiblicher Spiritualität oder lange Gehmeditation draußenOrganisatorisches: WANN | Wir treffen uns immer mittwochs ab ca. 19:00/19:30 und praktizieren ca. bis 21:00/21:30 Uhr gemeinsam.WO | Wir treffen uns in Privatwohnungen in Kahl. Bei schönem Wetter möchten wir in Zukunft auch den kompletten Abend draußen praktizieren. Die Gehmeditation führer wir immer draußen durch: geeignete Kleidung und Schuhe helfen daher.Praxismethoden: In der Plum Village-Tradition: Zu unseren Praxismethoden gehören Sitzmeditation (geleitet bzw. still), Gehmeditation; ergänzend ist z. B. Essmeditation möglichWeibliche Spiritualität: z. B. Yoga-Übungen; z. B. visuelle Reisen; z. B. Trommeln, singen oder tönen; z. B. Naturerlebnisse im Wald etc. Nicht bei jeden unserer Sangha-Abende muss es also eine “klassische” Meditation geben. Es gibt aber bei jedem Treffen eine spirituelle Praxis sowie einen Austausch (Dharma Sharing).Lehrer*innen / Inspirationen: Wir orientieren uns zum Einen an der Achtsamkeitspraxis und dem “Engagierten Buddhismus”, den Thich Nhat Hanh geprägt hat; zum Anderen an Chameli Gad Ardagh (“Awakening Women”)Wir freuen uns über weitere weibliche Mitglieder, die gemeinsam mit uns Achtsamkeit praktizieren und für die spirituellen Richtungen, die wir einschlagen, offen sind.Kontakt: Interessentinnen melden sich bitte am besten per E-Mail an MelaniePrengel@posteo.debeispielhafter Ablauf der Abende in der Plum Village Tradition:- 19:00 Uhr * Ankommen und “Check-in” (innerer Wetterbericht)- 19:10 Uhr * Gehmeditation draußen (z. B. in den Mainauen)- 20:00 Uhr * Heimkommen, Tee- und biologische Pause- 20:15 Uhr * Geleitete Meditation- 20:40 Uhr * Dharma-Text lesen- 21:00 Uhr * Dharma-Sharing- 21:30 Uhr * Ende

properties.name: Sangha Potsdam
properties.description: Seit dem 01.11.2022 praktizieren wir regelmässig Achtsamkeit in einer Gemeinschaft in Potsdam. Wir praktizieren, um das Glück zu nähren und das Leiden zu lindern. In uns selbst und in der Welt.SANGHA ABENDEDie Sanghaabende finden Montags von 19.00 bis ca. 21.15 Uhr statt. Geleitete Meditation, Sitzen in Stille, achtsames Gehen, Vortrag, achtsamer Austausch, gemeinsames Singen. Grundsätzlich sind volljährige Menschen zur Sangha eingeladen, die an einer langfristigen und regelmässigen Praxis in der Tradition des Plum Village / Thich Nhat Hanh interessiert sind. Alle Aktivitäten, die aus der Sangha organisiert werden, finden auf Spendenbasis statt.EINFÜHRUNGABENDVor dem ersten Besuch ist die Teilnahme an einem Einführungsabend in der Sangha Potsdam Bedingung. Am Am 13.05.2024 findet der kommende Einführungsabend statt. Für eine Anmeldung könnt ihr Benjamin eine Email schreiben.Besucher, die bereits Erfahrung mit der Praxis in der Tradition von Thich Nhat Hanh als Sanghamitglied oder Besucher eines Retreats im Plum Village haben, können die Praxisabende auch ohne Einführung nach einer Anmeldung per Email besuchen.ABLAUF DES EINFÜHRUNGSABENDS18.00 bis 18.15 Uhr Einlass, bitte Schuhe im Flur ausziehen und leise sprechen.18.15 bis 19.05 Uhr Einführung mit allgemeinen Informationen zur Sangha und zur Praxis.19.15 bis ca. 21.15 Uhr Praxis

properties.description: We are an active community of mindfulness practitioners, inspired by the teachings of Zen Master and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh. We gather together to practice sitting and walking meditation, share our joys and difficulties during Dharma Sharing, and to encourage each other on the path of practice. During these evenings we regularly drink tea together and sing songs accompanied by guitar. Our group welcomes practitioners of all traditions and experience levels to practice mindfulness in comunity. It is necessary that you speak at least a basic level of German.Currently, we are a stable group of 5-6 people ranging from anywhere between 25 and above 40 years of age. However, because we move to a new and bigger room this summer, we are in the process of raising awareness of our sangha, so that we can practice with even more friends. The new room will be only a few minutes from our current room and more towards the direction of Münster's city centre.

properties.description: With the guidance of Br Bao Tang we founded a young sangha for practitioners of all ages who identify with the LGBTQIA+ community or their issues. At every session we practise sitting and walking meditation, we read out a fragment of Thay's books and we have a Dharma sharing about our being both queer and Dharma practicioners, cultivating deep listening and loving speech. We meet every 2nd and 4th Friday of the month. We regularly organise mindful days and special thematic meetings to deepen our practise. As we are the only sangha designed for LGBTQIA+ in Italy, we also offer our siblings from outside Florence to attend our sessions online.

Humanum-Values Based Mindfulness Practice
properties.meeting: Wednesdays evenings from 7:30-9:30 & saturday mornings from 8:18-10:10
properties.description: We are a group of HUMANUM practitioners following the path of Thich Nhat Hanh tradition. We chose Thay's teachings as guidelines as we find them helpful to manage our daily lives easier and better. We call our practice Values Based Mindifuness because in our understanding mindfulness does not exist without compassion as the fundamental value. We follow the Five Mindfulness Trainings and read them regularly supporting it with recitation of other Thay writings. At the meetings we have 20 minutes of sitting meditation, 20 minutes of walking meditation and 20 minutes of lying meditation followed by Dharma sharing. We organize Humanum Mindfulness Days when we cook, eat,clean and watch Thay's lectures together and follow the 20-20-20 practice scheme twice a day. We are opened to everyone wishing to join us on the path of mindfulness practice.

properties.name: Rosensanghan

properties.description: Rosensanghan är en meditationsgrupp i Göteborg, som praktiserar i tradition efter den vietnamesiske Zenmästaren Thich Nhat Hanh. Vi tränar oss i medveten närvaro och djupt lyssnande, och stödjer varandra i strävan att fördjupa vår meditation och vår förmåga att leva väl, för oss själva och för andra.Rosensanghan har funnits sedan 2004. Några av oss har varit med länge och troget - andra kommer och går, utifrån behov och intresse. Bland oss finns både personer som har en stark personlig relation till just den här buddhistiska traditionen, och personer som har sina andliga rötter i andra sammanhang. Du måste inte vara eller bli buddhist för att praktisera med oss - det viktiga är att du har ett intresse av att ta del av traditionens meditationspraktik med ett öppet hjärta och sinne.

We recite the 5 Mindfulness trainings every other month.

There is an option to leave around 8pm if you cannot stay the full two hours.The sessions usually start with an informal chat, followed by: • Guided meditation • Mindful walking • Silent sit • Introductions • A reading • Dharma Sharing (reflecting on our own practice).Each week different members of the group facilitate the session. Chairs are provided, but if you use a meditation stool or cushion for sitting, please bring it with you.You are welcome to come along and give it a try. The venue we use is free so there is no cost involved. Please email if you would like to join us.If you are new to mindfulness you may like to attend a Be Calm Be Happy course run by Plum Village UK first, and then join us. https://plumvillage.uk/learn-mindfulness/

properties.description: This friendly group in the Plum Village Tradition meets every week, as we have for some years, for mindful sitting and walking, then we read a section of one of the books by Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We end by sharing insights and reflections from our practice, to water our wisdom and compassion.People can join and leave the group at any time. A more structured course can be found online, called ‘Be Calm Be Happy’. This may be particularly helpful for those new to this tradition or practice. For more details please visit: www.plumvillage.uk/learn-mindfulnessYou are very welcome to ring for a conversation before joining us to find out more; phone John Newson 0121 449 3977 or Emma 07946 451 954 john.n@phonecoop.coopMeetings are currently every Wednesday at Kings Heath Meeting House, 17 Colmore Road, B14 7PE. properties.name: Dharma Bell Sangha
properties.meeting: MONDAY MORNINGS: "FROM THE HEART" 08.30Offered via Facebook Live.WEDNESDAY SANGHA SITTING 18.30 - 20.00Via Zoom.
properties.description: The Dharma Bell Sangha roots itself in the Plum Village Tradition, taught by Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) and his disciples. We use Thay’s words, freely shared with us through his many books and teachings and these words support us to grow in love, compassion, understanding and awareness.The Dharma Bell Sangha is affiliated with Plum Village UK and as such some of the meditation sittings listed below are facilitated by Plum Village UK Lay Dharma teachers. Links to the practices provided by Plum Village UK can be found here: https://plumvillage.uk/Our weekly calendar looks like this:MONDAY MORNINGS: “FROM THE HEART” 08.30Offered via Facebook Live, the “From The Heart” sessions are a time where Andy shares a brief reading from Thay’s books, starting and closing with a brief meditation. From the Heart can be accessed from this page. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/558068675090521WEDNESDAY SANGHA SITTING, 18.30 – 20.00Our Wednesday night Sangha Sitting is provided via Zoom. We sit and share some of Thay’s teachings, such as working through a book together. We then meditate on what we have heard and enjoy a time of dharma sharing at the end. The link for these sessions is posted on the Dharma Bell Sangha page, usually the day before the sitting.Attending these practices does not tie you into anything, there are no conditions, expectations, obligations, or requirements and, best of all, there’s no fee! They are simply offered to support us all to progress in our path.Welcome! With a smile, Andy

properties.name: Chester - Boundless Heart Sangha
properties.address: Chester, Cheshire, North West, United Kingdom
properties.description: “So with a boundless heart one should cherish all living beings, suffusing the whole world with unobstructed loving-kindness”The Boundless Heart Sangha meets every Monday online starting at 7.00pm and is led by Sangha members. We begin with a personal and practice check-in, which enables the establishment of a warm community at the start of the session. We move to a period of sitting meditation, sometimes silent and sometimes guided. This is followed by a reading most commonly from one of Thay’s books, chosen by a Sangha member. On the first Monday of each month, this is replaced by the reciting of the five mindfulness trainings. We end with a period of ‘Dharma sharing’ where we share from the heart, and practise deep listening, or silent contemplation, finishing around 8.15pm .Sangha is rooted in the teachings of the Buddha and we welcome people from any, or no, faith background. Whatever our beliefs, we come together in the spirit of compassion and a desire to live fully and completely in every moment of our lives. Mindfulness means ‘keeping the conscious alive to the present reality’. We practise mindfulness in order to come back to what is happening in the present moment in our daily lives which allows us to slow our lives down; touch the healing elements that touch the boundless heart inside us and around us, and to nourish the seeds of joy, peace, compassion, and understanding in ourselves and others. Mindfulness supports us to live freely and to face everyday challenges with more balance and poise.We would love you to join us in our meditation practice. Please contact the Sangha on the email below for further information.

properties.name: Ipswich Sangha
properties.address: Barham Church Hall, Church Road, Barham, IP6 0PTIpswich, East Anglia, United Kingdom
properties.meeting: In-person and on Zoom every Thursday evening 6.30-7.30.
properties.description: Our Sangha was founded in 2001 by 6 members who had just been to Plum Village, the monastic community in France where Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh (or “Thay”) is based. (“Thay” means “Teacher” in Vietnamese)We meet (in-person and on Zoom) every Thursday evening 6.30-7.30. We are funded by donations quarterly or £2 on the night. In summer we meet at Barham Church Hall, Church Road, Barham, IP6 0PT , and in winter in each others’ homes. After a few minutes discussing business, the evening starts with a guided meditation, led in turn by the members, followed by a Tea Ceremony and a Dharma sharing. In the Dharma sharing we benefit from each other’s insights and experience of the practice. We listen deeply while members share their experiences, and refrain from giving advice. Whatever is shared is confidential.A small Dharma Study group meets every 1 or 2 months, at a member’s home, to watch a DVD of a talk by Thay.We hold a Morning of Mindfulness every 2nd Saturday of the month, 10am-1.00pm. This includes walking meditation, sitting meditation and other activities such as Touching the Earth, watching a video of Thay, Dharma sharing, etc. We all bring food and drink to share. For several years, we have organised an annual weekend retreat, in a hired centre.Any surplus donations are shared between Thay’s charities in Vietnam and the Community of Interbeing’s Practice Centre Project and Bursary Fund.Contact Isabelle for venues (isabellewen@hotmail.com or (01473)422155Our Mindfulness PracticeOur Sangha practises the art of mindfulness. Our breath is an essential element in our practice of mindfulness. It is always with us and unites our body and mind. The sound of the bell is also a central feature as it reminds us to come back to our breath and dwell in the present moment.Sitting meditation – There are many different postures recommended for sitting meditation. Thay recommends that we adopt a position where we feel comfortable and alert. This maybe cross-legged on a cushion, legs tucked underneath a stool or sitting upright on an ordinary chair. The breath should be deep and light. Our back should be straight. Our hands resting lightly in our lap or our knees. Our eyes can be lightly open or closed, and our mouth ideally in a gentle smile.The period of meditation begins with 3 sounds of the bell and is brought to a close with 3 sounds of the bell.Walking Meditation – When we practise walking meditation the breath is co-ordinated with our steps. When we hear the bell to start we take an in-breath and make one step with the left foot. On the out breath we take another step with the right foot. Then the cycle begins again. Throughout we are continually aware of the body.Recommended reading – “The Blooming of the Lotus”, “The Miracle of Mindfulness”, both by Thich Nhat Hanh.

properties.description: Welcome to the Winding Path Sangha (originally named the Iowa City Sangha). Founded on January 20, 2016, our community of lay practitioners follows the tradition of Vietnamese Buddhist teacher and peacemaker Thích Nhất Hạnh, who says there is no path to peace; peace is the path. Because we know that path can be winding and often challenging, and to support peace within ourselves and in the world, our Sangha gathers weekly to meditate, hear from teachings by Buddhist teacher Thích Nhất Hạnh and others, share about our practice, and discern together how to live fully in the present moment at home, at work, and in our community. Everyone is welcome, regardless of beliefs or previous experience with meditation, Buddhism, or mindfulness practices.

properties.description: We are a community practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We begin each practice session with silent sitting meditation, followed by walking meditation and a sangha topic of the week. We may listen to dharma talks, practice Touching the Earth, engage in Dharma Sharing, sing, chant, and engage in other activities to strengthen our mindfulness practice. On the first Saturday of each month, we rotate study and recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings and the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings of the Order of Interbeing. ​We are a peaceful and harmonious sangha that supports mindfulness in daily living--in our homes, in our families, in our workplaces, and in our communities.Organic Garden Sangha began practicing in 2003 and continues to meet every Saturday morning starting at 8:00 am.

For over 25 years, we have welcomed newcomers because we understand that at one time, we, too, were newcomers to Thich Nhat Hanh’s transformative teachings.

properties.description: We are dedicated to mindful living and engaged Buddhist practice. You do not have to be a Buddhist to practice with us. Many members continue to participate in other religious traditions while attending sangha. All are welcome.We practice mindfulness inspired by Vietnamese Buddhist monk Thich Nhat Hanh. The foundation for our being together is the Five Mindfulness Trainings, which are the Buddha’s teachings on the basis for a happy life.Our community practices mindful living in order to help reduce suffering while increasing joy, harmony and peace in ourselves, in our community and in the world. Mindfulness is the energy of being aware and awake to the present moment. It is the continuous practice of touching life deeply in every moment. To be mindful is to be truly alive, present and at one with those around you and with what you are doing. We bring our body and mind into harmony while we wash the dishes, drive the car or interacting with family, friends and colleaguesOur Practice includes:Mindful BreathingSitting MeditationWalking MeditationDharma SharingDharma talks

properties.name: Oregon - Wake Up Together
properties.description: At Wake Up Together, our weekly sangha gatherings are a cornerstone of our community and a source of deep connection and inspiration. Here's what you can expect:1️⃣ Engaging Dharma Talks: Our sangha gatherings feature insightful and uplifting Dharma talks delivered by our Order of Interbeing (OI) members. These talks offer practical teachings and guidance based on the wisdom of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. Be prepared to gain new perspectives, insights, and tools to apply mindfulness in your daily life.2️⃣ Mindful Meditation: Each sangha gathering begins with a period of seated meditation. Together, we create a peaceful and supportive space where you can immerse yourself in the practice of mindfulness. Through guided meditation or silent sitting, you will have the opportunity to cultivate inner stillness, clarity, and presence.3️⃣ Dharma Sharing: Heart-centered sharing is an integral part of our sangha gatherings. This is a safe and compassionate space where you can openly share your experiences, challenges, and insights related to your mindfulness practice. Through deep listening and mindful speaking, we create a supportive community where everyone feels seen, heard, and understood.4️⃣ Connection and Community: Our sangha gatherings provide a wonderful opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals who share a common interest in mindfulness and conscious living. You'll have the chance to meet and build relationships with fellow practitioners, fostering a sense of belonging and support on your spiritual journey.5️⃣ Mindful Rituals: Throughout the sangha gatherings, we incorporate mindful rituals that enrich the experience and deepen our connection with the present moment. These rituals can include reciting the Five Mindfulness Trainings, engaging in mindful walking, or other practices that cultivate mindfulness and reverence.6️⃣ Inspired Action: Our sangha gatherings are not just about personal reflection and growth; they also inspire us to take mindful action in our lives and communities. We explore ways to integrate mindfulness and compassion into our daily actions, and discuss opportunities for collective engagement and service.In summary, our weekly sangha gatherings at Wake Up Together provide a nurturing space for deepening your mindfulness practice, engaging in meaningful conversations, and connecting with a supportive community. It's a place where you can find inspiration, guidance, and a sense of belonging as you continue your journey of awakening and transformation.

properties.description: Meeting Place: Lifeguard Tower 22. We are a growing group of mindfulness practitioners who practice sitting meditation daily in Santa Monica, CA on the beach at Lifeguard Station 22. Dress warm & bring a beach towel or blanket for sitting. We suggest using the Sundial app to pick the ideal time when you want to come sit. Individuals typically sit for 1 to 2 hours at their own comfort and convenience. Practitioners can meet and socialize after the sitting meditation and we may try to coordinate mindful walking and compassionate listening sessions if there is interest. We can discuss our favorite Thich Nhat Hanh books, or how we got started meditating. We would like to suggest that everyone reads some of Thich Nhat Hanh's books (over 30 in english) and that they also download and check out the Plum Village App as a resource. As we all become better practitioners, we'll be able to help each other more. This is really a community run initiative, we're hoping to get it started, but we have no formal leadership structure. This is all about what works for each person, giving us a chance to meet others with similar practices and giving us the opportunity to grow a community (Sangha).

properties.description: Big Spring Sangha is a caring and inclusive community practicing in the Plum Village Tradition in Huntsville, Alabama. We meet weekly to practice sitting and walking meditation, Dharma sharing, and listen to Dharma talks. There is an opportunity to recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings once per month.

properties.name: Indiana - Flowering Smiles Sangha
properties.address: Roscommon Drive, Fort Wayne, IN 46805 United States
properties.description:
Flowering Smiles Sangha practices engaged Buddhism in the Plum Village tradition. We are open to all ages and all people. We meet Wednesday nights from 7 to 8:30.

We are exploring the Sutra on the Full Awareness of Breathing while cultivating a loving kindness relationship within ourselves, nurturing our compassion from insights and growing awareness of the three doors of liberation.

We'll watch a Plum Village video or read from one of Thay's books.  This is followed by a discussion to clarify the day's topic, relate it to the full discourse as a whole and how it supports our daily mindful practice.  We transition this knowledge with intent upon experiencing the topic through meditation.  Lastly, we have dharma sharing about our meditative experience and new awareness.

properties.name: Ontario - The Barley Jar - Urban Ecovillage and Spiritual Community
properties.address: Brunswick Avenue, Toronto, Ontario M5R 2Z5, Canada
properties.description: We are an intentional community and research/teaching/practice center that deeply aims to live sustainably socially, spiritually, environmentally and economically. Our desire is to be the change we want to see in the world.We share meals/cooking, groceries, cleaning/ chores, music/art/ideas, joint parties, community dinners, collective space and household items, a mixture of privacy and community. We have positive shared values / enthusiasm for sustainable transportation (bikes, no cars owned), local organic vegan food, natural materials (plastic free) and engaging in fairly traded purchasing. Inclusion and diversity are highly valued and desired e.g. no labels / all ages / all abilities / queer-positive / all backgrounds / all social (including marginalized) groups etc. We practice in the spirit of the Plum Village/Order of Interbeing traditions of engaged Zen Buddhism as described by Thich Nhat Hanh as a source of wisdom. We also pursue and choose practices supported by the best available scientific evidence.Plum Village practices that we currently regularly engage in several times per week to daily: morning sitting meditation, Dharma sharing, reading of books by Thich Nhat Hanh AND twice monthly: beginning anew. We are gradually incorporating more Plum Village traditions soon as we deepen our practice.

properties.description: Wake Up Brighton is a gathering of individuals under 35 (under 35-ish, folks who are a bit older but identify with this stage of life are very welcome). Please be aware that you do not have to identify as Buddhist to attend.We meet on the first Thursday of every month between 6.45pm-9pm in central Brighton. We ask folks to arrive 6.30pm for a 6.45pm start. Sessions are run on donation. Please email us for full address details and any questions at brightonwakeup@gmail.com. Unfortunately our venue is not on the ground floor so if you have access needs we might needs we are open to having a conversation to see if there are any adjustments we can make.A lotus to you :).

properties.description: Midwest Moon Sangha and Mindfulness Practice is a community in the Plum Village Tradition, observing sitting, silent, walking, working meditation, and other joyful and meaningful practices. Our root monastery is Magnolia Grove in Batesville MS. We are the practice center for PVT in the St. Louis MO area but our reach online has extended across the Midwest, even across the US. Midwest Moon Sangha is inclusive and welcoming to all traditions so long as they are healthy and wholesome, but our practice is certainly Plum Village. We offer online dharma talks as well. We have spun off two other communities in cose fellowship with our sangha: Rooted River Wake Up Sangha which meets 7pm on Wednesdays online; and a community in Carbondale IL as well as a budding group mid-Missouri Please join us!
